model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Do your sons like ice skating as well?
The older one seems to like it while the youngest cannot be bothered. Are you going to visit your sons in Europe soon?

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Children Studying Abroad', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A shares about his sons studying in Spain and going to Italy next.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker B: Ah, that's great. Only one of my sons loves Chinese food as much as I do. The other really just likes Italian food, so it can be difficult to decide where to go. ### Speaker A: It sounds like an international fight!!  My sons just got back from studying abroad. They are leaving again in a few months.  ### Speaker B: It's nice that you got to spend some time with them. I'd be so worried if my boys traveled so far away. Luckily it will be a long time before they're old enough. ### Speaker A: It's stressful and I worry all the time, but I am happy for them. Enjoying them while you can. They grow up fast.  ### Speaker B: Oh yeah, definitely. Where have your boys been studying? ### Speaker A: They have been in Spain and they are going to Italy next. The European tour!!' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Sons' Interests and Activities', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and Speaker B discuss their sons' interests in video games and creative pursuits.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: I know what you mean. My youngest son is addicted to social media and video games as well. He comes out of his room to eat, then I don't see him until the morning. ### Speaker B: At least they can pull themselves away from virtual reality long enough to keep themselves alive in real life. Ha. I'm trying to encourage him to get into programming or writing. My son was always very creative, I feel like he could be a great writer or game developer someday, but all he wants to do is co-op with his friends.' }
```
